image.altText: Bek Gillespie

props.synopsis: A night out on Bek Gillespie's first holiday as a family with her two nine-month-old twins descended into a frightening situation when one daughter put her fingers into a bowl of dumpling sauce.

title.children: Allergies are costing Australia billions. Why are they increasing?

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A convicted Canberra paedophile is jailed again after pleading guilty to repeat offences against a pair of young sisters, with the judge saying he has shown no remorse even after time in jail for similar offences.

title.children: Convicted paedophile back in jail for new offences against two sisters

image.altText: A man with pale skin and orange hair smiles for the camera

props.synopsis: Mr McLuckie's family were in court today to hear the plea, more than three years after he was killed.

title.children: Woman pleads guilty to causing crash that killed Matthew McLuckie

image.altText: Liz is mid-speech, sitting behind a microphone in the studio. She has brown long hair and wears a denim shirt.

props.synopsis: Liz Allen says she has concerns about a group set up by the ANU to oversee an investigation into bullying allegations she has made against senior leaders, including Chancellor Julie Bishop.

title.children: ANU academic concerned about group overseeing bullying investigation

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: The court heard the teenage boys were removed from the ACT after their older brother, who is facing trial, approached them on their way to school and took them to NSW to stay with their mother, who is also facing trial.

title.children: Mother and son facing trial for kidnapping her two younger sons

image.altText: A 3D sign reading "Australian National University" with a purple sky in the background.

props.synopsis: The Australian National University responds to concerns raised by Australia's higher education regulator after it demanded the university defend the conduct of its council members, while admitting there's "much work to do".

title.children: ANU admits it's at a 'critical point' as it defends leadership

image.altText: Shot of outside a building, with a person walking off out of focus in front of a painted wall.

props.synopsis: Questionable uses of force by staff on children and insufficient recording of incidents in Canberra's only youth prison are just a few of the critical findings in an independent oversight committee's new report.

title.children: 'Visibly distressed': Report questions use of force at Canberra's youth prison

image.altText: Trish and Ian, two older people, stand and smile in a garden outside a house.

props.synopsis: Stellulata is a co-housing project designed and built by three Canberra couples who wanted to enjoy both privacy and community.

title.children: Three Canberra couples create communal home by changing planning laws

image.altText: Hundreds of seagulls standing and flying outside Parliament House at nighttime.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of seagulls are ruffling feathers outside Parliament House, with the birds seeing the island in the middle of the forecourt water feature as a perfect nesting ground for their breeding season.

title.children: Seagulls reaching plague proportions outside Parliament House

image.altText: Bob Katter points his finger wearing a wide brimmed hat and a suit.

props.synopsis: Federal MP Bob Katter was speaking outside the Queensland Parliament with state members of the Katter's Australia Party about his intention to attend a March For Australia event this weekend.

title.children: 'I've punched blokes in the mouth for saying that': Bob Katter erupts at journalist

image.altText: Marles and Vance in black suit, red tie, Hegseth in blue suit, tie, all smiling, stand in front of Australia, US flags, table.

props.synopsis: Earlier, the Pentagon had said the pair had a "happenstance encounter", not a meeting, but it now says the meeting was scheduled in advance.

title.children: Pentagon walks back denial of Marles-Hegseth meeting

image.altText: female journalist stands in front of middle eastern city

props.synopsis: The previous China correspondent was forced to leave the country in 2020 after a five-day diplomatic stand-off over a national security case.

title.children: ABC to have China correspondent for first time in five years

image.altText: A man sits on a couch, looking to the side with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Seven years ago Richard Boyle's home was raided after he spoke out about heavy-handed debt collection tactics at the Australian Taxation Office. Now the whistleblower's case has finally closed, as he walks from court with a one-year good behaviour bond.

title.children: ATO whistleblower's 'suffered' for years since AFP raids

image.altText: A man with grey hair wearing sunglasses and a grey suit standing in front of a house door waving with an open hand.

props.synopsis: Iran's ambassador to Australia, Ahmad Sadeghi, has made his first public comments since being ordered out of Australia by the government. Follow live.

title.children: Iran's ambassador makes first public comments since expulsion

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 'I love Australian people': Iran's ambassador makes first public comments after expulsion
Pentagon confirms Marles and Hegseth did in fact have a 'meeting'
Usman Khawaja and PM discussed 'sensitive things' at meeting about Gaza this morning

image.altText: Jeff Fox, smiling, holds up medals in a green and gold Australia jacket.

props.synopsis: Australia's three-time Olympic gold medallist Jess Fox says she has been left with some "gnarly scars" and some added toughness after undergoing successful surgery.

title.children: Jess Fox sidelined after 'whirlwind' surgery to remove kidney tumour

image.altText: Stocks displayed on a screen at the ASX

props.synopsis: Qantas shares have risen strongly following a better-than-expected $1.6 billion net profit, but the ASX overall is fairly flat. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX seesaws as Qantas shares soar to record high

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: $90m fine 'absolutely not' the cost of doing business: Qantas boss
ASX still flat overall, despite some big moves up and down
Private sector business spending lifts: ABS

image.altText: A man and woman, holding hands and looking serious, walking outside a courtroom, on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Matt Wright's defence barrister David Edwardson KC has finished his closing address in the Netflix star's trial in the Northern Territory Supreme Court, with the judge now giving jurors their final instructions.

title.children: Matt Wright's defence says injured pilot 'failed in his duty' before crash – as it happened

image.altText: Two men standing side by side in bulletproof vests with a white car behind them.

props.synopsis: Russia's desire to take Donbas from Ukraine is so strong they are using troops on motorbikes as cannon fodder, and as they do this, Ukrainians are in a race against time to save civilians.

title.children: 'Suicide bikes': Russia's kamikaze tactics to take Donbas

image.altText: Barry Lawrence in a suit jacket participating in an interview.

props.synopsis: A West Australian man who was honoured last year with a prestigious award for excellence in child protection is charged with child sex offences.

title.children: Child protection award recipient charged with child sex abuse

image.altText: A group of police in uniform stand beside a four wheel drive car on the side of the road.

props.synopsis: A court hears a grandmother charged with stabbing two family members in a roadside attack may have acted violently as a result of medication she was taking.

title.children: Lawyer suggests Ozempic use led grandmother to stab family members

image.altText: An older Aboriginal man wearing a red headband.

props.synopsis: The family of Kumanjayi White, a young Warlpiri man who died in May after plain-clothes police restrained him in an Alice Springs supermarket, sues the NT government for damages.

title.children: 'Messed with the wrong family': Relatives sue over police restraint death

image.altText: Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: There is bipartisan support for expelling the Iranian ambassador and listing the IRGC as a terrorist organisation, but no end to the political brawl over antisemitic attacks in Australia.

title.children: The government takes swift action on Iran but the Coalition maintains the rage

image.altText: Six residents from Mount Atkinson stand with development plan leaflets

props.synopsis: Residents in Melbourne's booming outer west say developers have failed to deliver on their initial sales pitches — prompting a push for tighter restrictions on the way new communities are advertised.

title.children: Promised town centre in limbo years after residents bought into new suburb

image.altText: solar panels.

props.synopsis: The Powering Skills Organisation warns the current energy workforce of 300,000 energy, gas and renewables sector workers will not be sufficient to meet demand and further investment in training will be needed.

title.children: Net zero transition at risk of stalling amid shortfall of 42,000 workers

image.altText: Man in colourful shirt in a field.

props.synopsis: The remote central Queensland town is one of 15 local government areas in the state where alcohol restrictions are in place.

title.children: Mixed feelings as Indigenous community rolls back 17-year alcohol ban

image.altText: A Palestinian carries a box of food from the World Food Program with a group of other men.

props.synopsis: Israel's military has begun the next phase of the war — Operation Gideon's Chariots II. Some fear it could be even more deadly and devastating.

title.children: 'A city of ruins': Why the next moves in Gaza could be the most dangerous

image.altText: A white crystalline substance scattered across a surface.

props.synopsis: A Fijian judge has sentenced one man to life in prison and handed down other jail terms of up to 55 years after the country's largest-ever drugs trial.

title.children: Fijian court hands down toughest-ever drug sentences after $1.37bn meth haul

image.altText: Droughtmaster cattle in the Northern Territory

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the alleged theft of hundreds of cattle from a property in Central Australia. The NT Cattlemen's Association says it is not an isolated incident.

title.children: 'Large scale' cattle duffing in the NT under investigation

image.altText: A selfie of a man staring at a camera wearing a cap

props.synopsis: Clinton Wrigley has been sentenced to 23 years jail for the murder of Nyngan farmer Joel Carter, found dead inside his home in January 2023.

title.children: Farmhand jailed for brutally murdering farmer, burning evidence

image.altText: Priscilla Hon winds up to serve at the US Open.

props.synopsis: Australian qualifier Priscilla Hon stuns 17th seed Liudmila Samsonova to reach the third round of a grand slam for the first time.

title.children: Aussie qualifier Priscilla Hon reaches US Open third round with stunning upset

image.altText: Mitch Brown speaking to the Daily Aus.

props.synopsis: Openly gay male athletes are rare in mainstream Australian sport, but some have built up the courage to share their story.

title.children: Mitch Brown a rare example of a queer player in men's sport

image.altText: woman in underwear looking into mirror

props.synopsis: Despite up to 15 per cent of people in Australia having genital herpes, many of us find it extremely hard to talk about. But you can still have a fulfilling sex life with herpes.

title.children: 'Shame and disgust': Why we find this STI so hard to talk about

image.altText: Jimmy Barnes sings alongside a guitarist and pianist in a lavish family living room.

props.synopsis: From fascinating films on underrated cult bands to fresh perspectives on The Beatles and Cold Chisel, here's the latest and greatest music cinema.

title.children: From slacker rock to cult art-punk, these music docos are must-sees

image.altText: A man with facial tattoos with a crowd behind him

props.synopsis: Australian fans of Nashville star Jelly Roll rejoice at the news Townsville has scored a concert coup after mounting fan pressure and behind-the-scenes negotiations.

title.children: 'Country music mad' north lures global superstar for surprise show
